channel.title: My project - release
channel.description:
This is something I have been working on for a little bit of time now. It's nothing to "omg" about but some people may find its functionality useful.
First things first. I wanna give credits to Ruby because I used his news/announcement script and he has lead me in the right direction multiple times. google gets a little bit of credits and bootstrap.
What this site includes: [code] Admin panel: Delete users, ban users, lookup users, demote/promote users (normal user is 1, administrator is 9), add news, and view active users.
Fully working register and log in system with regular users and admins.
The homepage reads the last news posted (see example link below)
ability to comment on news.
and some other things that im too lazy to list. [/code] If you want to see the site in action you can go to hastingsunlimited.net
ADMIN PANEL: [IMG]http://i667.photobucket.com/albums/vv34/3m0h4x/adminpanel_zps0014f075.jpg[/img]
I have left a little bit of work. You will have to look inside index.php, news/index.php, admin/config.php, and includes/constants.php. You will also probably want to use your own images. There are some things on the navigation bar you wont have so you might wanna clean that a tad too.
To make yourself an admin; register and change your userlevel to 9 in the sql database and in constants(im pretty sure) there is a spot that allows you to make a constant administrator regardless what the sql db says. I hope you like and and all opinions good or bad are welcomed.
http://uppit.com/efqo1f84nq9s/bootstrap_site_complete.zip

item.title: My project - release
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:15, topic:474560”]“People like simplicity. Use white background.”
-HTML for Dummies[/quote]

Yea after thinking about that I removed the christmas one and kept it white. but thats on my site. If I make an significant changes ill upload an update

item.title: My project - release
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“tehjamdude, post:13, topic:474560”]This is kinda leached… I know exactly where you got the top bar and buttons from…

http://statfire.net/[/quote]
Totally leached. I penetrated the security of some website, stole the admin panel along with the php that controls it then released it to moparscape. you caught me.

lol your loveing stupid. its bootstrap which I already said. and no its not leached. Look at the credits before opening your mouth and letting the shit roll out. thanks.

Jatzo:

Looks nice but why not use MySQLi?

doesnt support what I was doing

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Found another bug for you jal:
When you click on, for instance, the about tab. It does navigate you to the correct section of the site, however, it doesn’t change the active tab.

item.title: My project - release
item.dc:creator: @aussie123 aussie123
item.description:
@aussie123 wrote:

after setting it up i get this PHP error message:

Warning: mysql_numrows(): supplied argument is not a valid MySQL result resource in /home/a9126591/public_html/include/database.php on line 207

Any help would be appreciated.

item.title: My project - release
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

Sibor:

It’s not too bad. Only problem I see with it is if you moved the buttons onto a table and do a row for each one. Also the background with the red shuold be removed to all white or whatever color you want.

Yea I might just put the buttons in tables. The background was kind of getting on my nerves but I wasnt sure if I wanted to just remove it right away with out thinking of something else besides white.

[quote=“Ruby, post:3, topic:474560”]Thanks! I’m probably going to take a couple day break from it.
Great job, Brian. Keep it up my friend.[/quote]

Read full topic
